name: Control Panel UI Render

movements.name: Render

beats.title: Generate Fields
beats.scenario: Generate Form Fields from Configuration Metadata
beats.testCase: generateFields populates fields array with layout/styling fields
beats.userStory: As an engineer, I need `generateFields` to derive UI elements from schema.

then: it performs its expected orchestration logic
and: emits expected side effects or returns expected value

beats.title: Generate Sections
beats.scenario: Generate Grouped Form Sections from Configuration
beats.testCase: should achieve the desired business outcome
beats.userStory: As an engineer, I need `generateSections` to group fields semantically.

then: it performs its expected orchestration logic
and: emits expected side effects or returns expected value

beats.title: Render View
beats.scenario: Render Complete Dynamic View with All Components
beats.testCase: expands viewBox when endpoints extend beyond element bounds (no rotation)
beats.userStory: As a runtime owner, I need `renderView` to render efficiently with memoization.

then: it performs its expected orchestration logic
and: emits expected side effects or returns expected value

movements.userStory: As a UI runtime engineer, I need rendering to generate fields and sections and draw views in <200ms P95.
movements.businessValue: Enables no-code form generation; reduces form creation time from hours to minutes; supports dynamic field generation per tenant

userStory: As a UI runtime engineer, I need rendering to generate fields and sections and draw views in <200ms P95.
businessValue: Enables no-code form generation; reduces form creation time from hours to minutes; supports dynamic field generation per tenant
